properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Warm temperatures continue this evening. With an increase in cloud cover and a high chance of precipitation tomorrow, temperatures will cool off over the next couple of days. A cold front will bring lower temperatures and scattered showers to the region on Friday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-28T05:59:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-27T19:37:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1257481546.2020
Area: Picton - Sandbanks Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy rain continues to fall over portions of the La Ronge region. Rain will continue to fall through the day before ending Thursday morning. The heaviest rain is expected to end this afternoon with total rainfall of 50-60 mm expected. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-28T01:54:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-27T16:30:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2741946535.2020
Area: Hwy 165 between hwys 2 and 914 including Pinehouse Lake, Lac la Ronge Prov. Park including La Ronge, Candle Lake Prov. Park and Narrow Hills Prov. Park, Montreal Lake and Molanosa, Prince Albert Nat. Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:50 P.M. ADT, Environnement Canada meteorologists are tracking a cluster of severe thunderstorms between Listerville, Knoxford, Beechwood and Bath. These thunderstorms are capable of producing very strong wind gusts, brief heavy downpours and 1 or 2 cm hail. The general motion is eastward at 30 km/h. Another active cluster of thunderstorms currently near Presque Isle Maine will reach the Aroostook, Perth-Andover and Dover Hill Area during the next 30 minutes, and then spread towards Arthurette and Plaster Rock. ### Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-05-27T22:59:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-27T21:07:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3650976746.2020
Area: Woodstock and Carleton County, Grand Falls and Victoria County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions will be favourable for the development of funnel clouds today. ### These types of funnel clouds are generated by weak rotation under rapidly growing clouds or weak thunderstorms. This weak rotation is normally not a danger near the ground. However, there is a chance that this rotation could intensify and become a weak landspout tornado. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-28T05:00:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-27T16:46:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0331141922.2020

Park, M.D. of Taber near Enchant
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing very strong wind gusts and damaging hail. The threat will end this evening. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2020-05-28T05:49:49-00:00

Area: Fort Albany, Moosonee
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Warm weather continues. This warm airmass will persist over southern Quebec for another day. Temperatures in the low to mid thirties continue this evening. Daytime highs are expected to reach between 29 and 31 degrees Celsius tomorrow with humidex values in the mid thirties. Overnight lows are forecast to be between 18 and 22 degrees Celsius tonight. Cooler temperatures are forecast for the end of the week. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-28T11:55:21-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 4:15 PM EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking two severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts and up to nickel size hail. The first severe thunderstorm is located 41 kilometres southeast of Moose River, moving northeast at 70 km/h. The second severe thunderstorm is located 47 kilometres east of Little Abitibi Provincial Park, moving northeast at 70 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-05-27T23:14:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-27T20:16:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1762792363.2020
Area: Moosonee, Little Abitibi - Kesagami Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: First heat event of the season continues through Thursday. Daytime temperatures in the low thirties are expected again tomorrow with humidex values in the mid thirties. A cold front will bring a few showers and lower temperatures to Eastern Ontario on Friday. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-28T11:32:06-00:00

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heat warning continued for this evening. Early evening temperatures near 30 degrees are creating humidex values in the mid to upper thirties as a result the heat warning has been continued. On Thursday temperatures will be cooler as a slow-moving cold front approaches from the northwest bringing showers and cooler air to the region. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Extreme heat continues this evening. With increasing cloud cover and a high chance of precipitation tomorrow, temperatures will be a bit cooler than the past couple days and are forecast to be in the mid to high twenties. Heat warnings will likely be ended this evening. A cold front will deliver considerably cooler and less humid air to Southern Ontario on Friday. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke from a forest fire near Sabbies River is causing a reduction in air quality due to smoke in its vicinity and areas downwind to the east and northeast. Locations: Sabbies River to Rogersville and vicinity. Short range wind forecast: Winds northeasterly 20 km/h diminishing to light this evening. On Thursday, winds are forecast to be southwest 20 km/h. Remarks: The forest fire is still out of control from Wednesday morning and is covering an estimated area of 838 hectares as reported by New Brunswick Natural resources and Energy Development. More information will be provided as it becomes available. ### Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-05-28T11:31:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the New Brunswick Department of Environment and Local Government, the New Brunswick Department of Health, 2020-05-27T19:32:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1607556441.2020
Area: Stanley - Doaktown - Blackville Area, Kent County, Kouchibouguac National Park, Miramichi and area
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the New Brunswick Department of Environment and Local Government, the New Brunswick Department of Health

properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Ice build-up due to freezing rain is expected or occurring. The freezing rain is expected transition to snow by this evening. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Ice build-up due to freezing rain is expected or occurring. A low pressure system moving through northern Manitoba is bringing freezing rain at times to Brochet, Tadoule Lake and Churchill. As the cold air slides southward tonight, there is a potential for a few hours of freezing rain at Lynn Lake, Thompson, and Gillam. Further north, the freezing rain should transition to snow and then end during the night. The freezing rain will taper off Thursday morning as the low weakens and moves off to the east. ### Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-28T12:28:53-00:00

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Humidex values reaching 33 are expected for the next day. A period of very warm and humid weather is expected. Time span: Tonight and Thursday, possibly into Friday. Locations: northwestern New Brunswick. Minimum temperature tonight: 20 degrees C Maximum temperature Thursday: 32 degrees C (Humidex 39) Locations: Eastern New Brunswick. Maximum temperature Thursday: 32 degrees C (Humidex 39) Minimum temperature Thursday night: 18 degrees C Maximum temperature Friday: possibly 30 degree C Remarks: Warm temperatures near 30 degrees will occur Thursday with overnight temperatures near 18. Temperatures Friday will likely reach 30 degrees again on Friday. Cooler conditions will occur this weekend. ### Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 4:18 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts and up to nickel size hail. This thunderstorm is located 83 kilometers west of Matagami and is moving northeast at 70 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-05-27T23:14:45-00:00
